intro: Cuphea fulgida, commonly known as the flamebeard plant, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, fiery red bracts that surround its small white flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is dark green and glossy, adding a rich contrast to its vibrant floral display. Cuphea fulgida is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower due to its long-lasting blooms.
